docs.lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson reported yesterday that its net income for the first quarter ended March 31 increased by six-tenths of 1 percent, to $111.3 million, from $110.6 million in the corresponding quarter of last year. Earnings per share amounted to $1.80 in both periods. Sales of the health-care products company rose 12.4 percent, to $1.34 billion, from $1.19 billion. The company said its withdrawal from the domestic disposable diaper market resulted in a nonrecurring write-off against first-quarter earnings of $16 million. When the company made its decision to leave the $1 billion market last February, its share of the business had slipped to 8 percent.
